title: A Fast Algorithm for Consistency Checking Partially Ordered Time. (arXiv:2305.15917v1 [cs.CC])
abstract: Partially ordered models of time occur naturally in applications where agents or processes cannot perfectly communicate with each other, and can be traced back to the seminal work of Lamport. In this paper we consider the problem of deciding if a (likely incomplete) description of a system of events is consistent, the network consistency problem for the point algebra of partially ordered time (POT). While the classical complexity of this problem has been fully settled, comparably little is known of the fine-grained complexity of POT except that it can be solved in $O^*((0.368n)^n)$ time by enumerating ordered partitions. We construct a much faster algorithm with a run-time bounded by $O^*((0.26n)^n)$. This is achieved by a sophisticated enumeration of structures similar to total orders, which are then greedily expanded toward a solution. While similar ideas have been explored earlier for related problems it turns out that the analysis for POT is non-trivial and requires significant new

translated_title: 一种检查部分有序时间一致性的快速算法
translated_abstract: 时间的部分有序模型在应用中自然而然地出现，这些应用中代理或进程不能完美地彼此通信，可以追溯到Lamport的开创性工作。本文研究了判断是否一个（可能不完整的）事件系统的描述是一致的问题，即部分有序时间（POT）点代数的网络一致性问题。虽然这个问题的经典复杂性已经完全解决，但是关于POT的细粒度复杂性的了解相对较少，除了可以通过枚举有序分区以$O^*((0.368n)^n)$时间解决。我们构造了一种更快的算法，其运行时间仅为$O^*((0.26n)^n)$。这是通过对类似于全序的结构进行精细枚举，然后向解决方案贪婪地扩展来实现的。虽然早期的类似想法已经在相关问题中探索过，但实际上POT的分析是非平凡的，需要重大的新成果。
tldr: 本文提出了一种快速算法来检查部分有序时间的一致性，相比已有算法时间复杂度更低，为$O^*((0.26n)^n)$，是通过对类似于全序的结构进行精细枚举，并贪婪地扩展向解决方案实现的。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a fast algorithm to check the consistency of partially ordered time, with a lower time complexity of $O^*((0.26n)^n)$ compared to existing algorithms. The algorithm enumerates structures similar to total orders and greedily expands towards a solution. This is achieved through significant new analysis for the fine-grained complexity of partially ordered time.
